events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at a busy intersection involving two vehicles.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident due to collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim for further processing.
The customer received acknowledgment of the claim filing and was informed of next steps.
Requested photographs of the damaged vehicle and police report related to the vehicle accident.
Customer submitted all necessary documents including photos and the official accident report.
The investigation into the accident details and liability began immediately after documents submission.
Investigation finalized determining fault and assessing the total damage to the vehicle involved.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on damage evaluation and policy terms.
Customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the handling and proposed settlement.
The auto accident claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment was disbursed to the customer as compensation for damages under the insurance policy.
The claim was closed after successful settlement and payment issuance with no further issues.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
